class ai_flow.workflow.control_edge.ConditionType(value)[source]¶

Bases: str, enum.Enum

MEET_ALL: The action will be triggered when and only all the EventConditions are met. MEET_ANY: The action will be triggered when any of the EventConditions is met.

MEET_ALL = 'MEET_ALL'¶
MEET_ANY = 'MEET_ANY'¶
class ai_flow.workflow.control_edge.ControlEdge(destination: str, scheduling_rule: ai_flow.workflow.control_edge.SchedulingRule)[source]¶

Bases: ai_flow.graph.edge.Edge

ControlEdge defines event-based dependencies between jobs(ai_flow.workflow.job.Job).

Parameters

  • destination – The name of the job which depends on the scheduling rule

  • scheduling_rule – The scheduling rule of the job

class ai_flow.workflow.control_edge.EventCondition(events: List[ai_flow.workflow.control_edge.EventMeetConfig], condition_type: ai_flow.workflow.control_edge.ConditionType)[source]¶

Bases: ai_flow.util.json_utils.Jsonable

EventCondition combines a list of EventMeetConfig and a ConditionType to defines when the condition is met based on the events we see.

Parameters

  • events – A set of EventMeetConfig that the condition interested in.

  • condition_type – condition_type defines when the condition is met.

add_event(event_key: str, event_value: str, event_type: str = 'UNDEFINED', namespace: str = 'default', sender: Optional[str] = None, life: ai_flow.workflow.control_edge.EventLife = EventLife.ONCE, value_condition: ai_flow.workflow.control_edge.ValueCondition = ValueCondition.EQUALS)[source]¶
class ai_flow.workflow.control_edge.EventLife(value)[source]¶

Bases: str, enum.Enum

ONCE: The event value will be used only once. REPEATED: The event value will be used repeated.

ONCE = 'ONCE'¶
REPEATED = 'REPEATED'¶
class ai_flow.workflow.control_edge.EventMeetConfig(event_key: str, event_value: str, event_type: str = 'UNDEFINED', namespace: str = 'default', sender: Optional[str] = None, life: ai_flow.workflow.control_edge.EventLife = EventLife.ONCE, value_condition: ai_flow.workflow.control_edge.ValueCondition = ValueCondition.EQUALS)[source]¶

Bases: ai_flow.util.json_utils.Jsonable

EventMeetConfig defines a set of criteria of the event we are interested in.

Parameters

  • event_key – The Key of the event(notification_service.base_notification.BaseEvent).

  • event_value – The value of the event(notification_service.base_notification.BaseEvent).

  • namespace – The namespace of the event(notification_service.base_notification.BaseEvent).

  • event_type – (Optional) Type of the event(notification_service.base_notification.BaseEvent).

  • sender – The sender of the event(notification_service.base_notification.BaseEvent).

  • life – ai_flow.workflow.control_edge.EventLife

  • value_condition – ai_flow.workflow.control_edge.MetValueCondition

class ai_flow.workflow.control_edge.JobAction(value)[source]¶

Bases: str, enum.Enum

START: Start the job. RESTART: If the job is running, stop it first and then start it. If the job is not running,just start it. STOP: Stop the job. NONE: Do nothing.

NONE = 'NONE'¶
RESTART = 'RESTART'¶
START = 'START'¶
STOP = 'STOP'¶
class ai_flow.workflow.control_edge.MeetAllEventCondition(events: Optional[List[ai_flow.workflow.control_edge.EventMeetConfig]] = None)[source]¶

Bases: ai_flow.workflow.control_edge.EventCondition

MeetAllEventCondition is met when all the events are met.

EventCondition combines a list of EventMeetConfig and a ConditionType to defines when the condition is met based on the events we see.

Parameters

  • events – A set of EventMeetConfig that the condition interested in.

  • condition_type – condition_type defines when the condition is met.

class ai_flow.workflow.control_edge.MeetAnyEventCondition(events: Optional[List[ai_flow.workflow.control_edge.EventMeetConfig]] = None)[source]¶

Bases: ai_flow.workflow.control_edge.EventCondition

MeetAnyEventCondition is met when any event is met.

EventCondition combines a list of EventMeetConfig and a ConditionType to defines when the condition is met based on the events we see.

Parameters

  • events – A set of EventMeetConfig that the condition interested in.

  • condition_type – condition_type defines when the condition is met.

class ai_flow.workflow.control_edge.SchedulingRule(event_condition: ai_flow.workflow.control_edge.EventCondition, action: ai_flow.workflow.control_edge.JobAction)[source]¶

Bases: ai_flow.util.json_utils.Jsonable

A SchedulingRule defines what TaskAction to take when the condition is met. :param event_condition: A config that defines the condition. :param action: The action to take when condition is met.

class ai_flow.workflow.control_edge.ValueCondition(value)[source]¶

Bases: str, enum.Enum

EQUALS: The condition that notification service updates a value which equals to the event value. UPDATED: The condition that notification service has a update operation on the event key which event

value belongs.

EQUALS = 'EQUALS'¶
UPDATED = 'UPDATE'¶

class ai_flow.workflow.job.Job(job_config: ai_flow.workflow.job_config.JobConfig)[source]¶

Bases: ai_flow.graph.node.Node

Job is a description of an executable unit, which contains information about the configuration and data required to run.

Parameters

job_config – Job configuration information(ai_flow.workflow.job_config.JobConfig).

property job_name¶

The name of the job.

ai_flow.workflow.job_config module¶

class ai_flow.workflow.job_config.JobConfig(job_name: Optional[str] = None, job_type: Optional[str] = None, properties: Optional[Dict[str, ai_flow.util.json_utils.Jsonable]] = None)[source]¶

Bases: ai_flow.util.json_utils.Jsonable

JobConfig is the configuration information of the Job(ai_flow.workflow.job.Job).

Parameters

  • job_name – Name of the configured job.

  • job_type – The job type of the job, such as bash python etc..

  • properties – Properties of the configured job.

static from_dict(data: Dict) → ai_flow.workflow.job_config.JobConfig[source]¶

Build JobConfig from a dict. The dict example: {‘job_name’:{‘job_type’:’bash’, ‘properties’: {}}}

Convert the JobConfig to a dict

ai_flow.workflow.periodic_config module¶

class ai_flow.workflow.periodic_config.PeriodicConfig(trigger_config: Dict)[source]¶

Bases: ai_flow.util.json_utils.Jsonable

Define the periodic running configuration of the running unit (ai_flow.workflow.job.Job and ai_flow.workflow.workflow.Workflow).

Parameters

trigger_config – Support two types of configuration:

1. cron config: {‘start_date’: ‘start_date_expression’, ‘cron’: ‘cron_expression’} start_date_expression: year:int,month:int,day:int,hour:int,minute:int,second:int,Option[tzinfo: str] cron_expression: seconds minutes hours days months weeks years 2. interval config {‘start_date’: ‘start_date_expression’, ‘interval’: ‘interval_expression’} start_date_expression: year:int,month:int,day:int,hour:int,minute:int,second:int,Option[tzinfo: str] interval_expression: days:int,hours:int,minutes:int,seconds:int

ai_flow.workflow.status module¶

class ai_flow.workflow.status.Status(value)[source]¶

Bases: str, enum.Enum

INIT: INIT is the execution unit creation status. STARTING: STARTING is the execution unit starting status. FINISHED: FINISHED is the successful state of the execution unit. FAILED: FAILED is the failed state of the execution unit. KILLED: KILLED is the state of the execution unit being stopped.

FAILED = 'FAILED'¶
FINISHED = 'FINISHED'¶
INIT = 'INIT'¶
KILLED = 'KILLED'¶
RUNNING = 'RUNNING'¶

ai_flow.workflow.workflow module¶

class ai_flow.workflow.workflow.Workflow[source]¶

Bases: ai_flow.graph.graph.Graph

Workflow defines the execution logic of a set of jobs(ai_flow.workflow.job.Job) Workflow is composed of jobs(ai_flow.workflow.job.Job) and control edges(ai_flow.workflow.control_edge.ControlEdge).

Parameters

  • name – the name of Node

  • properties – node properties

  • output_num – each node has outputs, this represents the number of outputs

add_edge(job_name: str, edge: ai_flow.workflow.control_edge.ControlEdge)[source]¶

Add control edges to workflow. :param job_name: The name of the job that depends on edges. :param edge: A control edge that the job depends on.

add_edges(job_name: str, edges: List[ai_flow.workflow.control_edge.ControlEdge])[source]¶

Add control edges to workflow. :param job_name: The name of the job that depends on edges. :param edges: A list of control edges that the job depends on.

add_job(job: ai_flow.workflow.job.Job)[source]¶

Add a job to the workflow.

property control_edges: Dict[str, List[ai_flow.workflow.control_edge.ControlEdge]]¶

Return the control edges of the workflow

property jobs: Dict[str, ai_flow.workflow.job.Job]¶

Return the jobs in the workflow.

property workflow_name¶

Return the name of workflow.
